posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
"The two stood, staring at each other, both forgetting Kitiara, who--feeling the silent, deadly contest being waged between the two--forgot her own anger, holding her breath to witness the outcome. "Your magic is strong," Raistlin commented. A soft wind stirred the branches of the oak trees, caressed the black folds of the mage's robes. "Yes," said Lord Soth quietly. "I can kill with a single word. I can hurl a ball of fire into the midst of my enemies. I rule a squadron of skeletal warriors, who can destroy by touch alone. I can raise a wall of ice to protect those I serve. The invisible is discernible to my eyes. Ordinary magic spells crumble in my presence." Raistlin nodded, the folds of his hood moving gently. Lord Soth stared at the mage without speaking. Walking close to Raistlin, he stopped only inches from the mage's frail body. Kitiara's breath came fast. Then, with a courtly gesture, the cursed Knight of Solamnia placed his hand over that portion of his anatomy that had once contained his heart. "But I bow in the presence of a master."

* Time of the twins, Dragonlance Legends

posts.author: varlak74
posts.content:
I understand this post is old but, there is an error in its sequence. You can't choose Blackguard by lvl 7, BAB is to low. You must wait to 1 more level. If you go with 2 level of rogue then you must pick up 5 level of fighter and then you can pick-up Blackguard by lvl 8. It is not much of an issue but I had a mini heart attack when I've reached lvl 7 and couldn't choose blackguard. But 1 level later I could.

For some reason I can't link the build but I've added a spreadsheet with the modifications to my post.

posts.author: varlak74
posts.content:
Played this build trough the original campain. Played on DnD difficuty and I will try it on the SoF serie. I role played it as neutral evil and being role playing mean that I wouldn't eat trap if I detect them and had no mean to disarms. So I might have pass on some good item/money.

First it start good as all str fighter wearing full plate. Being able to use trap early on was nice. The first few casters gave me trouble same as with all my str character it seems.

Mid chapter 2 get rough all the way to nearing end of chapter 3. I wouldn't had survived without a tanking merc (used the evil monk to suite my role play). I had to chug a lot of healing potions. More then I am used too since it was my first non shield character. But being able to use magic device make the hardest fight kinda easy.  Without it, that build would have been horrible to play.

Then you get your third summons and the game just get so easy. He fear even balor lords, sneak damage start to be meaningful and divine shield AC makes me so thought. With divine shield I literally went from being paper made to hard steel material. It was a fun game, I'd say the challenge was fun but here are my final thought for an OC gameplay.

1) Pick up Divine Shield prior Divine Might. With +4-6 charisma bonus, might is barely noticeable on dmg dealing while having the possibility to add 4 to 6 AC would have made the game a way easier.

2) Don't be afraid to spend huge pile of golds on scrolls and potions. They are more valuable then any item you could buy prior chapter 4.

3) Succubus is really good if you do not play in DnD rule where she cast AoE spell that hurt you.

4) If I ever play this char again I'll try to squeeze another +2int so I could get intimidate for role play purpose. I feel that BG are meant to brutalize others.

5) Being a fighter with summon was refreshing for me. For the OC I feel that sword and board would had been better with the low str bonus. But for SoF, I think that my greatsword will be rocking on.

Thansk for the build.
